Clinical trials: The mRNA vaccines for COVID-19 underwent randomized controlled trials involving tens of thousands of people, which were reviewed by multiple groups of experts. These trials demonstrated the safety and effectiveness of the vaccines against symptomatic illness.
Vaccine safety monitoring systems: The CDC and FDA implemented vaccine safety monitoring systems specifically for the COVID-19 vaccines. These systems, including the v-safe smartphone-based reporting tool, have identified only a few rare adverse events, indicating the overall safety of the vaccines.
Common side effects: The COVID-19 vaccines have been found to have common side effects such as injection site pain, fatigue, headache, muscle pain, and fever. These side effects are expected and not indicative of any major safety concerns.
Full approval: The Pfizer/BioNTech and Moderna COVID-19 vaccines have received full approval from the FDA for emergency use and individuals aged 16 and older (Pfizer/BioNTech) or 18 and older (Moderna). This approval further validates the safety and efficacy of the vaccines.
